729529f-b.text:
(1)
Rockland Avenue, north side, 600 yards east of Richmond Avenue, showing a frame dwelling along the lase that leads into the property of Charles H. Blair from Rockland Avenue, opposite the old Oscar Prall House. The lane is popularly known as Corson's Lane, after the owner of the
property, who owned it before Blair.
June 20, 1926
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A barn on the Blair nroperty, along Corson's Lane.
July 18, 1926
P. L. Sperr

729536f-a.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, 600 yards east of Richmond Avenue. This farmhouse is situated 500 yards back of the avenue, on the lane--popularly known as Corson's Lane--running into the Charles H. Blair propehty, formerly owned by Corson. The lane is opposite the old Oscar Prall
House.
July 18, 1926
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
June 20, 1926
P. L. Sperr

729347f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Rockland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729530f-a.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, about 350 yards east of Richmond Avenue. The house and property was owned by Adam Martin Sr. from 1898 to 1907, and by Herman Weiseman in 1917. Dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729530f-a.folder: Rockland Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729313f-c.text:
(1)
2141 Richmond Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Rockland Avenue, showing the Gerald Darcey house (1917 map). From 1874 to 1898 it was owned by Decker, and in 1907 by Pearl W. Hokes.
November 2, 1922
Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the house viewed northward toward Rockland Avenue. The house in the center of the view is at the N.E. corner
of the two avenues.
April 25, 1929
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additional view at a later date.
August 1, 1937
P. L. Sperr

729531f-a.text:
(1)
Rockland Avenue, north side, 600 yards east of Richmond Avenue (vantage point), showing the lane that runs north from Rockland Avenue into the property of Charles H. Blair. The lane is popularly known as Corson's Lane, after Corson who owned the property prior to Blair. In the background is visible the
farmhouse.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr  November 2, 1922
(2)
A closer view of the farmhouse.
November 2, 1922
P. L. Spcrr
(3)
A later view of the lane and farmhouse. The house is
500 yards north of Rockiand Avenue.
JuneWo. 1926
L. Sperr
